trail.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to pull something behind you, especially along the ground, or to be pulled in this way
trail.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: A plane trailing a banner was circling overhead.
She walked slowly along the path, her skirt trailing in the mud.
Rees was leaning out of the boat trailing his hand through the water.
trail.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to walk slowly, especially behind other people because you are tired or bored
trail.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Susie trailed along behind her parents.
We spent the afternoon trailing around the shops.
trail.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to be losing in a game, competition, or election
trail.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The Democratic candidate is still trailing in the opinion polls.
He trailed in last after a disastrous race.
Manchester United were trailing by two goals to one.
trail.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction
trail.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Police trailed the gang for several days.
trail.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
trail.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The trail led over Boulder Pass before descending to a lake.
trail.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a long line or a series of marks that have been left by someone or something
trail.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
The typhoon left a trail of devastation.
trail.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a series of unpleasant situations or feelings that have been left by someone or something
trail.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: He left a trail of broken hearts and broken promises.
trail.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a sign that a person or animal has been in a place, used for finding or catching them
trail.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: The hunters lost the tigerâ€™s trail in the middle of the jungle.

trail.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: all the places that a particular group of people visit for a particular purpose
trail.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: a town on the tourist trail
trail.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: the set of things that someone does to achieve something
trail.translation[1].definitions[5].exam: New players should put the team back on the winning trail.
